Body Characteristics: Light-bodied with refreshing citrus and floral notes.
Finish: <bold>Fresh</bold> and crisp, with a lingering grapefruit zest.
Aroma: Delicate floral aromas with white peach and grapefruit peel.
Flavor: Delicate fruit flavors with a clean grapefruit finish.
Vinification: Cold skin maceration before pressing. Aged in vats on fine lees. Temperature-controlled vinification.
Maturation: Aged on fine lees in vats.
General Recommended Accompanies: Seafood tapas, grilled fish, lemon-fried squid fritters, prawns al ajillo, tuna empanadas
Summary: Symphonie Rosé 2024 is a <bold>light-bodied</bold>, <bold>dry</bold> rosé from <bold>Côtes de Provence</bold>, crafted from <bold>Grenache</bold>, <bold>Cinsault</bold>, and <bold>Rolle</bold> grapes. It showcases <bold>floral aromas</bold>, <bold>white peach</bold>, and <bold>grapefruit peel</bold> on the nose with a <bold>crisp finish</bold>. Produced by Château Sainte Marguerite, this organic, vegan wine is best enjoyed chilled with seafood or as an aperitif.
